meanings.def: a passage built underground, for example to allow a road or railway to go through a hill, under a river, etc.
examples: They have been digging underground tunnels in the mountains since the 1960s.
A gust of wind passed through the tunnel.
A service tunnel runs between the two buildings.
The initial section of tunnel had to be dug by hand.
The train disappeared into a tunnel.
They've built a new tunnel through the mountain.
We got lost in the maze of tunnels.

meanings.def: an underground passage made by an animal or natural processes
examples: The badger sett had twelve entrances to what must have been a labyrinth of tunnels.
The tunnel opened out into a large cavern.

meanings.def: something that shows you are nearly at the end of a long and difficult time or situation
examples: For the first time since the start of his treatment, we can now see light at the end of the tunnel.

idioms.idiom: light at the end of the tunnel

meanings.def: to dig a tunnel under or through the ground
examples: + adv./prep. The engineers had to tunnel through solid rock.
tunnel your way + adv./prep. The rescuers tunnelled their way in to the trapped miners.
